com.shop.util.generic
Class GenericIOClientPool<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.shop.util.generic.GenericIOClientPool<T>

public class GenericIOClientPool<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Manages a pool of connections to a single GenericIOServer server.

Field Summary
static int DEFAULT_KEEP_ALIVE_TICKS
          Can be passed to the constructor as the value for keep_alive_ticks
static int DEFAULT_RETRY_CONNECTION_TICKS
          Can be passed to the constructor as the value for retry_connection_ticks

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GenericIOClientPool

public GenericIOClientPool(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                           boolean ssl,
                           int retryConnectionTicks,
                           int keepAliveTicks)
Create the pool

Parameters:
address - server's address/hostname and port
ssl - if true, use SSL connections
retryConnectionTicks - number of ticks to wait before re-trying failed connections
keepAliveTicks - ticks after witch to close old connections
Method Detail

getAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getAddress()
Return the address/port for this pool

Returns:
address

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Returns true if the pool is an open state

Returns:
true/false

isOpenAndNoReopener

public boolean isOpenAndNoReopener()
Returns true if the pool is an open state and there is no current reopener

Returns:
true/false

reopen

public boolean reopen()
Attempt to reconnect to a server. An internal thread is started and will continue to attempt to reconnect periodically. Once reconnection is successful, get(AtomicBoolean) will return connections. NOTE: if a reopen is currently in progress, this method does nothing.

Returns:
true if a new reopener was started - false if one already existed

get

public GenericIOClient<T> get(java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean isNew)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Get a connection from the pool. IMPORTANT: each connection returned must released via a call to release(GenericIOClient) or releaseAndClose(GenericIOClient)

Parameters:
isNew - if not null, will get set to true if the connection is brand new (i.e. not from the internal free list)
Returns:
the connection. Will return null if the pool is not in an open state
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - any errors

release

public void release(GenericIOClient<T> client)
Release a connection retrieved from get(AtomicBoolean) and add it to the free list

Parameters:
client - the connection (cannot be null)

releaseAndClose

public void releaseAndClose(GenericIOClient<T> client)
Release a connection retrieved from get(AtomicBoolean). Unlike release(GenericIOClient), the connection is closed and not added to the free list. Use this method when there is an error with the client

Parameters:
client - the connection (cannot be null)

close

public void close()
Close all connections to the server and put this pool in a closed state
